function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Transmission of sars-cov-2 in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 through air and environmental compartments such as water, soils, and waste water","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complicated sample handling in the laboratory for pcr testing","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High population density and mobility in jakarta contribute to fast transmission of covid-19.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High association of covid-19 infections with air pollution in cities, particularly those exceeding pollution limits.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improvement of air quality in barcelona, spain, under lockdown measures.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Correlation between no2 levels and covid-19 outbreak","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Influence of pollen on covid-19 infections","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of sewage as an indicator of the scale of infection, including covid-19, and the development of waste-based epidemiology wbe methods.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Development of paper sensor devices for rapid diagnosis of pathogens in untreated wastewater samples, including the use of pcr and paper-based devices.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible airborne transmission of covid-19 in patient rooms","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortage of supply chain for critical ppe","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate evaluation of drug therapies for covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate evaluation of traditional medicinal plants for covid-19 treatment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Promotion of unproven and potentially unsafe treatments for covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continued high incidence and distribution of vectorborne diseases vbds","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vector-borne diseases and zoonotic diseases are implicated, disproportionately impacting people in tropical climates with inadequate access to health services, poor housing, weak governance structures, and socio-economic underdevelopment.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Uneven distribution of progress in tackling vector-borne diseases vbds across the world and across all diseases.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Emerging vector-borne diseases, such as zika virus zikv and chikungunya chik , have infected millions and are linked to neurological and developmental disorders in infants.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underdeveloped thematic areas for vbds: community participation, citizen engagement, social differentiation, and wider system dynamics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased contact between biting insect vectors, animal hosts, and humans due to deforestation.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in vegetation and land cultivation dynamics due to deforestation shifting vector-animal relations.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unplanned urbanization leading to proliferation of slums and inadequate sanitation, leading to increased vector-borne disease transmission","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proliferation of aedes aegypti and aedes albopictus in urban areas leading to spread of dengue fever, zika, and chikungunya","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Migration of people, goods, and vehicles across borders and seas translocates vectors and pathogens to new areas.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Natural disasters and armed conflicts disrupt existing medical services and contribute to landscape changes, leading to increased vulnerability to disease outbreaks.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Movement between low-and high-risk areas contributes to the spread of drug-resistant and emerging infectious diseases.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability as the level of exposure and sensitivity to vbds minus adaptive capacity","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poverty increases vulnerability to vector-borne diseases vbds by limiting people’s ability to cope with health risks.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex interplay of social, cultural, economic, and environmental factors contributes to vulnerability to vbds.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in standardizing metrics for measuring vulnerability to vbds across different contexts.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Overlapping transmission of multiple parasitic or viral diseases by the same species of mosquito.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited attention to the pervasive co-infection in neglected tropical diseases ntds .","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Affirmative attitude towards residential space leading to complacency","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Rapid mutation of microorganisms and adaptation as a cause of human diseases","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Indoor work places not designed to prevent the spread of airborne pathogens","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Air distribution systems may enhance transmission of airborne pathogens","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Methods applied should be non-life threatening, user friendly, and energy efficient","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of respiratory droplets with deep lung pathogens during coughing","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of influenza a virus and other respiratory diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Respiratory aerosols containing pathogen-carrying particles emitted during coughing","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Coughed droplets with a size distribution of 0.62-15.9 mm were studied, indicating potential risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"More particles were retained in the sample bag during the cough droplet study, indicating potential for increased exposure to infectious particles.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"No significance was found in the effect of age and gender on droplet generation, potentially leading to underestimation of transmission risk in different demographic groups.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Evaporation and dispersion of respiratory droplets","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spread of infectious bioaerosols from vomit and feces","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in pathogen infectivity due to viruses.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"}]}
